list_definition.definition: a long narrow piece of wood, plastic etc for drawing straight lines

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I can’t draw straight lines without a ruler.

list_ex_of_english: In both cases the reasons are generally ideolog ical, relating to the reputations of the rulers in power at the time.
In order to administrate effectively, the colonial powers were interested in establishing communities with clearly defined rulers.
As a result, many rulers turned to parochial and exclusive identity groups, such as ethnicity, for support.
Many new townships were established by these rulers in different parts of the country.
They were also sometimes seized and moved by rulers and would-be rulers seeking to make use of their symbolic power.
They were not the formal way whereby leaders were chosen and did not represent the linkage between the rulers and the ruled.
The rulers of today are perceived to a lesser degree than in the past as benefactors, albeit still as the most efficient potential protectors.
The ethics and rhetoric of exemplarity took precedence over the provision of complete chronicles of rulers, deeds, and battles.
